AdditionalFields.Value: Clinical Research,Molecular/Cellular Biology and Genetics,Prevention / Early Detection / Interception

Description: This AACR-JCA joint session will explore the genomic landscape and evolving molecular drivers of gastroesophageal cancers. The recent emergence of biomarkers and novel drugs has significantly altered the treatment and outcomes of this disease. This session will cover the role of biomarkers in systemic therapy selection, including claudin-18.2, FGFR2b, Her2, MSI, and CPS. Finally, the session will review specific drugs, approvals for new agents, as well as supporting data.
SearchResultBody: SS03. AACR-JCA Joint Session: Novel Molecular Drivers of Gastroesophageal Cancers and Evolving Biomarker Driven Therapies
Title: AACR-JCA Joint Session: Novel Molecular Drivers of Gastroesophageal Cancers and Evolving Biomarker Driven Therapies
